description: Two notes. When you get bored, keep one and pick a new one. Repeat as long as you can.
Three notes until you get bored. Then pick three new ones. Repeat as long as you can.
The vertical axis is pitch. The horizontal is time. It should take about 2 minutes to play.
Yourself to three notes. You can play them in any octave. Do this for as long as you can.
Or gesture using a part of your body. Now translate the motion through your instrument.
Notes only. Keep everything choppy, using as many pitches as you like. Do this for as long as you can.
A piece of text from a book or magazine using your instrument. Use only three note, in any octage. Trade setence if you're in a group.
Or tap out any repeating ryhtm. Now play it with your instrument using as many pitches as you like.
Five notes in only one octave.
Four notes in any octave. When you get bored, keep two and pick two new ones. Repeat.
Four notes in only one octave.
Two groups of 4 notes. These are your “chords.” Improvise with the first group for 8 measures. Then switch. Repeat for as long as you can.
Play musical “simon.” Play two random notes. Repeat over and over, adding a new note to the end of the sequence each time. See how long you can go.
A melody that you know well. Now repeat it over and over, but alter it by changing some (or all) of the pitches. Do not change the rhythms.
What you did last weekend, using whatever notes or sounds you like.
